result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Etchison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
Joint and several with co-defendant.

10/14/15 AMENDED:  COURT ORDERS THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS MAY TAKE A DEDUCTION OF 25% OF THE INMATE'S ACCOUNT EACH TIME MONEY IS RECEIVED TO BE CREDITED TO RESTITUTION.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no contact with the victims in this case.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
